info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 14 at 11:19AM MDT until October 14 at 2:30PM MDT by NWS Pueblo CO
info.description:
* WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Colorado, including the following counties, Mineral and Rio Grande.
* WHEN...Until 230 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1116 AM MDT, Flood reports were from fire department officials in South Fork along with CDOT and Colorado State Patrol personnel. - This includes the following streams and drainages... South Fork Rio Grande and its tributaries. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... South Fork and Forest Service roads with access off highway 160 upstream of South Fork. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON
